block.p: Tara Francesca Schoenberger and James Anthony Neumann were married yesterday in Roslyn, N.Y. Msgr. John J. Rowan, a cousin of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church.
Mrs. Neumann, 30, is a vice president for sales and marketing at Open Link Financial, a software company in Uniondale, N.J. She graduated from Skidmore College.

Tara Francesca Schoenberger and James Anthony Neumann were married yesterday in Roslyn, N.Y. Msgr. John J. Rowan, a cousin of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church.
Mrs. Neumann, 30, is a vice president for sales and marketing at Open Link Financial, a software company in Uniondale, N.J. She graduated from Skidmore College.

She is the daughter of Angela Monte of Lattingtown, N.Y., and Paul M. Schoenberger of Roslyn. Her father retired as the deputy undersheriff in charge of investigations, operations and special operations for the Nassau County Police Department in East Meadow, N.Y.; he is now a partner in Kroll, Moss & Kroll, a law firm in Garden City, N.Y. Her stepfather, Fortune Monte, owns GCP Management, a real estate management company in Little Neck, Queens.
Mr. Neumann, 38, is the chief financial officer of Colangelo Synergy Marketing in Darien, Conn. He graduated cum laude from Providence College and received an M.B.A. degree from Fordham University.

He is a son of Kathleen and Gerard Neumann of Saddle River, N.J. His father is a retired lawyer; his practice was in West Nyack, N.Y. The bridegroom's mother is a former adjunct professor of English, who taught until 1998 at Ramapo College of New Jersey in Mahwah.
